DataElement.preferredName: Kaposi Sarcoma Stage Karnofsky Performance Status Grouping Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether the Karnofsky performance status is <70.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Kaposi Sarcoma Stage Karnofsky Performance Status Grouping
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to Karnofsky performance status (a standard way of measuring the ability of cancer patients to perform ordinary tasks; the scores range from 0 to 100, with a higher score indicating a better ability to carry out daily activities) and the staging (the extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body) of Kaposi Sarcoma (a malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells. Erythrocyte extravasation and hemosiderin deposition are frequently present. The most frequent site of involvement is the skin however, it may also occur internally.  It generally develops in people with compromised immune systems including those with acquired immune deficiency syndrome (AIDS).:The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

Concepts.definition: A malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells. Erythrocyte extravasation and hemosiderin deposition are frequently present. The most frequent site of involvement is the skin; however it may also occur internally. It generally develops in people with compromised immune systems including those with acquired immune deficiency syndrome (AIDS).
The extent of a cancer in the body.

Property.preferredDefinition: Karnofsky Performance Status. A standard way of measuring the ability of cancer patients to perform ordinary tasks.  The scores range from 0 to 100, with a higher score indicating a better ability to carry out daily activities.  KPS may be used to determine a patient's prognosis, to measure changes in functioning, or to decide if a patient could be included in a clinical trial.:Grouping; a system for classifying things into groups; the activity of putting things together in groups.

Concepts.definition: An index designed for classifying patients 16 years of age or older by their functional impairment.
A system for classifying things into groups or the activity of putting things together in groups.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Karnofsky performance status is greater than or equal to 70 within 14 days prior to step 2 registration

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Karnofsky performance status is greater than or equal to 70 within 7 days prior to registration

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF TEXT 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Karnofsky performance status is greater than or equal to 70 within 28 days prior to step 2 registration

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF TEXT4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Karnofsky performance status >= 70 within 14 days prior to registration

ReferenceDocuments.name: ECOG-ACRIN - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a Karnofsky Performance Status of greater than or equal to 60?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ECOG-ACRIN - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a Karnofsky Performance Status of greater than or equal to 60 percent?
